scope.objective: Establish sound practices for the safe use of electricity at construction and demolition sites
scope.usage: To be used in conjunction with AS/NZS 3000, Electrical installations (Australian/New Zealand Wiring Rules)
scope.application: Construction sites, demolition sites, temporary electrical installations

technical_committee.title: Wiring Rules
technical_committee.type: Joint Standards Australia/Standards New Zealand Committee

New Zealand Manufacturers and Exporters Association

key_changes_2019.as_nzs_3000_updates: Requirements updated to reflect changes to AS/NZS 3000

switchboard_compliance.change: Reference to AS/NZS 61439.4 included for switchboard compliance for Assemblies for Construction Sites (ACS)

acs_switchboard_construction.change: Clause title amended to 'Assemblies for construction sites (ACS) switchboard construction'

additions: Figure from AS/NZS 3010:2017 for connection from standalone generator to site switchboard with MEN link and electrode (Figure 2.1)
Figure from AS/NZS 3010:2017 for isolated winding generator with integral socket outlets (Figure 2.2)
Figure from AS/NZS 3010:2017 for generator with integral RCD protected socket outlets (Figure 2.3)

emergency_lighting.change: Requirement to prevent unauthorized disconnection of emergency lighting with detachable connections

temporary_protected_lighting.change: TPL as defined in AS/NZS 60598.2.20 is not considered festoon lighting

personnel_requirements.change: Reference to qualified person or competent person requirements

out_of_service.requirement: Out of service tag to be attached to non-compliant equipment

compliant_equipment.requirement: Tag for compliant equipment to include person name (and company if applicable), test and re-test date

standards_references.added: AS/NZS 60598.2.20, Luminaires, Part 2.20: Particular requirements—Lighting chains
standards_references.updated: Building Code of Australia (BCA) replaced with National Construction Code of Australia (NCC)
